page.title: 15ARTS AND CRAFTS (2)
page.content: INTERVIEW WITH MR BOA John Horton and I went to interview Mr Boa on Monday the twentieth of May 1985. We found out the following information. Mr Boa is 86 and he has lived in this area for 34 years.He used to work as a hallboy in a mansion and also as a shepherd.He retired at the age of 70 in 1969.He made his first walking stick at the age of seven.Most of his wood comes from Caithness and Loch - Ness.It takes a whole day to make a walking stick but four days to varnish it and for the varnish to set in.Mr Boa works 8 hours a day at one walking stick.He made a stick for Prince Charles and Lady Diana.He never received any letters of thanks.He became interested in sticks because his uncle showed him how to make one.
